channel.title: node on An old coder
channel.description: Recent content in node on An old coder

item.title: What Have I Learned - Update 2
item.description: Well it has been a busy week. Lets have a look back at all of the new things I have ‘learned’1 in order to get my web application up and running. JSRender and JSView So the biggest thing for me was learning to integrate JSRender and JSView into my web application. I can’t get over how well they work and also how easy they were to use. I am not really stressing either library but I took the HTML creation for a fairly complex display and turned it into a template and took the code needed to create it into one line.

item.title: Shell Scripting
item.description: So I didn’t wait to get other work done and went ahead and built the shell script to automate converting all of my csv files. I did a few stackoverflow searches to find some information about getting filenames into a shell script and then iterating over them. I also had to look up how to determine the filename without the extension as I had to create a new .json filename for the output file.

item.title: More csv work
item.description: I finally managed to finish my csv to JSON workflow. I originally tried usingMiller to export my csv to JSON but it didn’t provide all of the options that I needed. I managed to find a node library called csvtojson that had all of the tools I needed. It also lets you edit the header names to create nested JSON data in a way that I needed as well. I will be keeping Miller handy though as I will have more csv work to do in the future.

item.title: Using Node to build CLI tools
item.description: So I have been working with various command line tools and apps to try to build a workflow to let me take csv data that I export from a spreadsheet and turn it into JSON. This actually isn’t too difficult and there are a lot of tools, like Miller, that will let you take csv and monkey with it. It has a lot of options but many of them seem to be tools to work with CSV, or similar, data and not a lot of them seem to be options for JSON.
